public static java.lang.String indent(java.lang.String lines,
                                      java.lang.String prefix)
indents the specified multiple lines with a string as prefix. This is useful to display strings nicely on screen.

Parameters:
lines - multi-line string to be indented
prefix - a string, most likely a certain number of \t
Returns:
the indented string

convert

public static <U,V> V[] convert(U[] original,
                                java.lang.Class<V> type)
converts an array of elements of type U to an array of elements of type V. It calls convert(String, Class) to do smart conversion into numbers.

Type Parameters:
U - the type of the elements of the original array.
V - the type of the elements of the new array.
Parameters:
original - the array of elements of type U.
type - the class object that represents class V.
Returns:
the array of elements of type V.

convert

public static <V> V convert(java.lang.String str,
                            java.lang.Class<V> type)
converts a string to a value of type V that the string represents. If V extends Number, it tries to parse the string and obtain a numeric value.

Type Parameters:
V -
Parameters:
str -
type -
Returns:
the value of type V that the string represents.

getStackTrace

public static java.lang.String getStackTrace(java.lang.Thread thread)
obtains the stack trace of a given thread. This is useful in locating the cause of a deadlock.

Parameters:
thread -
Returns:
the string that represents the stack trace of the given thread.

printStackTraces

public static void printStackTraces()
displays the stack traces of all threads active in the system.

printStackTraces

public static void printStackTraces(boolean allThreads)

randomTest

public static void randomTest(java.lang.String tag)
generates a random number and displays it. This is useful in checking whether a game configured in the same way (including the same seed for the random number generator) will lead to the exactly same results across different runs.

Parameters:
tag - a string to indicate where an output is generated from.

                                         int length)
Parameters:
value -
length -
Returns:
an array of the specified length that has the given value in each entry, or null if length is not positive.
